derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the sense separate from general access): from late Latin sequestrat- 'given up for safe keeping', from the verb sequestrare (see sequester)

entry.tran: (通常指按照法庭决议)扣押，查封(债务人资产)
entry.def: When property is sequestrated, it is taken officially from someone who has debts, usually after a decision in a court of law. If the debts are paid off, the property is returned to its owner.

example.ex: He tried to prevent union money from being sequestrated by the courts.
example.tran: 他试图阻止法院扣押工会的资产。

sentences.sentence: "He sequestered himself in his study to write a book"
"The dentist sequesters the tooth he is working on"

sentences.en: to close up and sequestrate the goods
